entry.title: [Global][Database] - Cloud Databases services MongoDB
entry.content:
Mar 14, 17:34 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 14/03/2024 10:00 UTC
End time : 14/03/2024 17:25 UTC
Root cause :
If you experience difficulties to connect to your service following the creation or deletion of a password during the incident please reset user password.
The issue was in the automation that was not applying correctly the password. The password were not leaked nor compromised.

Mar 14, 16:43 UTC
Identified - Start time : 14/03/2024 10:00 UTC
Service impact :New user and user which the password have been reseted since beginning of the incident can't connect to the MongoDB service.
Root cause : Due to a bug introduced in user automation, password are not applied properly. Preventing customer from connecting to their Mongodb service.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [GRA5|GRA7|GRA9|GRA11|SBG5|WAW1|DE1|UK1][Public Cloud][Managed Kubernetes Service] - Maintenance on all nodes running in managed Kubernetes clusters
entry.content:
Mar 14, 13:58 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Mar 12, 18:24 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 14/03/2024 17:00 UTC
End time : 14/03/2024 23:00 UTC
Service impact : Interrupted connection up to 30 seconds between cluster controle plane and managed nodes workload when component names "ovhcloud-apiserver-proxy" restart (nodes processed sequentially).
Root cause : Update of "ovhcloud-apiserver-proxy" managed pods running in customers' Public Cloud instances to improve network connection between nodes and control planes. This patch is already delivered since one week ago, this maintenance only target existing managed clusters. Intervention will be done during non-working office hours.

entry.title: [GRA11/WAW1/UK/DE1][Containers/Orchestration] - Managed Kubernetes Service/Gen3 instances
entry.content:
Mar 13, 08:49 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 04/03/2024 12:00 UTC
End time : 13/03/2024 08:41 UTC
Service impact : The patch has successfully been applied and gen3 flavors are now available again for existing and new MKS nodepools.
Services are working as they should be.

Mar 8, 10:46 UTC
Update - Issues on volume attachment/detachment are still present on gen3 machine.
Nodepool creation has been disabled for gen3 flavors until a fix is deployed on PCI regions.
Existing nodepools are still able to add new nodes, manually or with autoscaler as usual.
MKS autohealing is still fixing impacted instances by hard rebooting when needed.

PCI will deploy a fix next week (starting on UK1 followed by other impacted regions in the following days).
MKS nodepool creation will be reactivated on a region when fix will be deployed on it.

Mar 5, 09:46 UTC
Identified - A definitive fix is on its way to be validated and will be rolled out once done.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

Mar 4, 13:00 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 04/03/2024 12:00 UTC
Service impact : Impacted nodes could be stalled in read-only and cannot process workloads.
Root cause : PCI gen3 instances randomly encounter a malfuction when attaching/detaching block volumes that leaves the instance's system disk read-only and therefore unusable.
Mitigation : MKS autohealing is actually fixing by hard rebooting the instances in that case to mitigate impact on the customer workload.
